table.description: Sequenced and Specific Task(s) Necessary to accomplish the scope of work are identified; Work Boundaries including hold points for tasks are clearly identified; Warning, Caution and Notes statements are included.
table.label: Operations

table.description: WPC ACTION: Generate Work Order for each Resource as a Summary work order.
table.label: Resources

table.description: WPC: Choose from High Hazards for the entire job. Specific Hazards (as needed) will be at the Work Order Level.
table.label: Hazards

table.description: WPC: Include materials from Stores and any materials ordered.
table.label: Materials

table.description: WPC: Include EH&S SMEs needed for job and if there auhorizations
table.label: EH&S Support

table.description: WPC: Permits required for this task.
table.label: Permits Needed

section.label: Scope of Work: What needs to be accomplished, condition to be achieved, problem being corrected?

statictext.label: <font color = #FF0000>When applicable, Not Applicable may also be used to answer a question.</font>

helpgrid.innerhtml: To find labor available during a specific date range, enter the dates in the Available From and To fields. To see labor available on a specific shift, enter the Shift. To include labor who are already assigned to other jobs, select Include Assigned Labor.
This will generate a new walk-through template from the selected work order walk-through record.
This table displays a list of PMs that require alerting. Select PMs to create Work Orders.

The following assets and locations are safety-related assets for the current work order. Each asset might have safety hazards that affect the work environment of the current work order. Select hazards to Apply to Work Order. To finish, click Done.
